title: 115_hr2835
content: There is no relevant information provided in the prev_chunk to summarize the curr_chunk. Section 7(a) of the Small Business Act is amended to include a guarantee fee waiver for veterans or spouses of veterans in connection with certain loans. The Administrator may not collect a guarantee fee for loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or spouses of veterans after a specified date. The President's budget for the upcoming fiscal year may exempt loans from certain requirements if the cost for the program is above zero. Additionally, a guarantee fee waiver for veterans is included in the paragraph. The President's budget for the upcoming fiscal year may exempt loans from certain requirements if the cost for the program is above zero. A guarantee fee waiver for veterans is included in the paragraph, allowing for the waiver of guarantee fees for loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or their spouses. The paragraph exempts loans from requirements if the program cost is above zero. It allows for a guarantee fee waiver for loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or their spouses. The Administrator may not collect a guarantee fee for express loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or their spouses. The Administrator cannot collect a guarantee fee for express loans of up to $150,000 made to veterans or their spouses, unless the President's budget for the upcoming fiscal year shows a cost above zero for the program. Title 31, United States Code, states that if the program cost is above zero, clause (ii) requirements do not apply to express loans made in the upcoming fiscal year.
